com.syntax.manage

Class JavaCodeAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.syntax.manage.JavaCodeAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AbstractCodeAdapter

    public class JavaCodeAdapter
extends java.lang.Object
implements AbstractCodeAdapter
    An implementation of AbstractCodeAdapter. It can handle syntax coloring of java file
    See Also:
    AbstractCodeAdapter

        public JavaCodeAdapter()
                throws SyntaxException
        Construct JavaCodeAdapter
        Throws:

    • Method Detail

      • getDefaultAttributeSet

        public javax.swing.text.AttributeSet getDefaultAttributeSet()
        Get default attribute from SyntaxManager which is specified by constructor
        Specified by:
        getDefaultAttributeSet in interface AbstractCodeAdapter
        Returns:
        attribute for SyntaxTextArea

      • insertString

        public void insertString(int start,
                         java.lang.String text,
                         SyntaxTextArea textArea)
        Color syntax after text inserted into SyntaxTextArea. Color and Keyword collected by JavaSyntaxAttributes and JavaKeyWord
        Specified by:
        insertString in interface AbstractCodeAdapter
        Parameters:
        start - the index where the text was inserted. If the location is the head of paragraph, offset will be 0. If the location is the end of paragraph, offset will be the length of paragraph before text inserted
        text - the specified string which is instered to paragraph
        textArea - registered syntax text area
        See Also:
        JavaSyntaxAttributes, JavaKeyWord

      • remove

        public void remove(int start,
                   java.lang.String text,
                   SyntaxTextArea textArea)
        Color syntax after text removed from SyntaxTextArea. Color and Keyword collected by JavaSyntaxAttributes and JavaKeyWord
        Specified by:
        remove in interface AbstractCodeAdapter
        Parameters:
        start - the index where the text was removed. If the first character at the head of paragraph, offset will be 0
        text - the text which is removed from paragraph
        textArea - registered syntax text area
        See Also:
        JavaSyntaxAttributes, JavaKeyWord

      • replace

        public boolean replace(int offset,
                       int length,
                       java.lang.String text,
                       SyntaxTextArea textArea)
        Description copied from interface: AbstractCodeAdapter
        Replace text on SyntaxTextArea
        Specified by:
        replace in interface AbstractCodeAdapter
        Parameters:
        offset - the start position of replacement
        length - the length of replacement
        text - replace the text in [offset, offset + length) with text
        textArea - registered syntax text area
        Returns:
        true to make SyntaxTextArea replace text through remove() and insertString() in sequence. false to make SyntaxTextArea do nothing
